answers.author: Caitlyn Mitchell
answers.text:
I apologize because I cannot answer this question fully on account of my not working for any particular city, but at the bottom of this post is a website link that will take you to a self-certifcation check list that should give you a basic outline of what you are looking for. The form is for the city of Chicago, and their particular self-cert program has been in place for several years already. The city even hosts how-to classes for interested developers; a new round is about to start in April. Here is a phone number for you to call for some of your more specific questions: (312) 743-7039.
http://www.cityofchicago.org/content/dam/city/depts/bldgs/general/SPR/SPRProjectsubmittalchecklist_110308.pdf

author: Megan Yaniglos
text: Does anyone have a process for site plan or subdivision reviews that rely on engineering self-certification of plans? Will you share the process and how it has worked out in your community? Pros and cons? Has it been successful?
title: Engineering Self- Certifications
